intro: Mollinedia estrellensis, commonly known as Estrella's mollinedia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and purple. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its mountainous habitat. Due to its limited distribution and sensitivity to environmental changes, it is considered a vulnerable species. Its unique botanical features make it an important subject for ecological and conservation studies.
